title: RS22607
content: It is a federal crime to assault, kidnap, or kill a federal judge or their family members with the intent to obstruct or retaliate for the judge's duties. This protection extends to federal law enforcement officers, prosecutors, and any federal officer or employee. The penalties for threatening, attempting, or conspiring to assault, kidnap, or kill federal judges or law enforcement officers are increased under Section 207 of P.L. 110-177. Maximum penalties for voluntary manslaughter are raised to 15 years and for involuntary manslaughter to 8 years. Section 207 of P.L. 110-177 increases penalties for voluntary manslaughter to a maximum of 15 years and for involuntary manslaughter to a maximum of 8 years. The amendment extends to various federal jurisdictional circumstances, providing protection for witnesses in federal judicial, Congressional, and administrative proceedings.
